casebody.data:
STANDARD MILLING COMPANY, Appellant, v. Joseph T. HIGGINS, Individually and as Collector of Internal Revenue for the Third Collection District of New York, Appellee. No. 190. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. Jan. 17, 1936. See, also, E. Regensburg & Sons v. Higgins, 79 F.(2d) 516. Sullivan & Cromwell, of New York City (David W. Peck and John F. Dooling, Jr., both of New York City, of counsel), for complainant. - Frank J. Wideman, Asst. Atty. Gen., James W. Morris, Sewall Key, and Andrew W. Sharpe, Sp. Assts. to Atty. Gen., F. W. H. Adams, U. S. Atty., and Francis H. Horan and Edward J. Ennis, Asst. U. S. Attys., all of New York City (William F. Young, Sp. Asst, to U. S. Atty., of New York City, of counsel), for appellee. Stanley Daggett, of New Haven, Conn., and William H. Edwards, of Providence, R. I. (Daggett & Hooker, of New Haven, Conn., and Edwards & Angelí, of Providence, . R. I., of counsel), for Ponemah Mills, amici curias.

Before MANTON, SWAN, and CHASE, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Decree reversed, and cause remanded to the District Court, with directions to enter a decree enjoining collection of the tax. An appropriate order shall be entered directing the repayment to the plaintiff of any cash, bonds, or funds which have been impounded or deposited below. Rickert Rice Mills, Inc., v. Fontenot, 56 S.Ct. 374, 80 L.Ed. -, January 13, 1936.
